article_title: Now's your last chance to use these Social Security strategies
article_text:
As a result of Congress' passing a new federal budget — likely by the end of April — you will no longer be able to use two Social Security strategies: "file and suspend" and "restricted application."

Depending on your situation, these strategies greatly increase the amount you receive from Social Security — for some, by tens of thousands of dollars over a lifetime. And the retirees most likely to benefit from them are high-income married couples. No wonder Congress killed them.

article_metadata.description: When Congress passes a new federal budget, two common Social Security claim strategies of use to married couples are likely to be killed.
article_metadata.author: Ric Edelman, founder and CEO of Edelman Financial

og.description: When Congress passes a new federal budget, two common Social Security claim strategies of use to married couples are likely to be killed.

article_summary:
Depending on your situation, these strategies greatly increase the amount you receive from Social Security — for some, by tens of thousands of dollars over a lifetime.
As a result of Congress' passing a new federal budget — likely by the end of April — you will no longer be able to use two Social Security strategies: "file and suspend" and "restricted application."
No wonder Congress killed them.
And the retirees most likely to benefit from them are high-income married couples.
